result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury selection on December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:03 AM 2021CF000146, 2022CF000018, 2021CF000139 - Defendant Rick A Carter in court.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Rick A Carter.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Curran asks for reset and if not acceptable then asks for a trial date. Court sets jury trial dates and another hearing 60 days out. 

Attorney Curran asks if these cases will be trialed separately. Attorney Forehand states that she will be filing a motion to join. All motion must be filed by 11/08/22 as well.
Jury selection scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final status/scheduling conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:28 AM 2021CF000146, 2022CF000018, 2021CF00139 - Defendant Rick A Carter in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Rick A Carter. Attorney Curran states that there isn't any resolution on this case but  request a continuance. Attorney Forehand explains that Attorney Curran wants his client to get counseling in order to change  her offer. Attorney Forehand states that they are close to getting this resolve. Victim in court and speaks. Victim okay with addition time. Court removes the jury trial and schedules a status in this case.
Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:36 PM Defendant Rick A Carter in court.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael C. Curran in court for Rick A Carter. Attorney Curran provides the preliminary questionnaire wavier to the court. Court binds over for trial. Attorney Forehand is filing an information with the same charges. Attorney Curran stands mute.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

for Victim to appear by Zoom
Preliminary hearing on May 25, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:04 PM  2021CF139, 2021CF146, 2022CF18 - Court appoint Attorney Curran in 22CF18. Attorney Curran doesn't have the complaint in the new case. (22CF18) Attorney Forehand states that the defendant was given the complaint. Clerk prints off another copy for the defendant. Court goes over the criminal complaint. 

Court asks for a status of the other two cases. Attorney Forehand indicates that she has given an offer to defense. Attorney Curran has received the offer but the defendant doesn't accept the offer at this time. 

Attorney Curran waives the time limits to the preliminary hearing in 2022CF18.

Court sets jury trial dates on 2021CF139 and 2021CF146. Preliminary hearing set in 2022CF18.
Initial appearance on May 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
